t: To the choirmaster: with stringed instruments; according to The Sheminith. A Psalm of David.
O*pn Lord,*s rebuke me not in your anger, nor*ld discipline me in your wrath.
Be*ln gracious to me, O Lord,*s for I am languishing; heal*ld me, O Lord,*s for my bones are troubled.
My*ln soul also is greatly troubled. But*ld you, O Lordâ€”*s how long?
Turn,*pn O Lord,*s deliver my life; save*ld me for the sake of your steadfast love.
For*ln in death there is no remembrance of you; in*ld Sheol who will give you praise?
I*pn am weary with my moaning; every*ld night I flood my bed with tears; I*ld drench my couch with my weeping.
My*ln eye wastes away because of grief; it*ld grows weak because of all my foes.
Depart*pn from me, all you workers of evil, for*ld the Lord*s has heard the sound of my weeping.
The*ln Lord*s has heard my plea; the*ld Lord*s accepts my prayer.
All*ln my enemies shall be ashamed and greatly troubled; they*ld shall turn back and be put to shame in a moment.
